text:

James Arthur has broken his silence about the traumatising moment he was glassed by a jealous thug over a one night stand with the man's ex. 
The 2012 X Factor champion has opened up about the "disturbing" assault by Chris Revell - who was jailed for five and a half years earlier this month for the incident - which saw him attacked with a pint glass and punched to the ground. 
"It was an ordeal. It was tough to see footage of it," James told The Sun . "It was quite disturbing to see it. I'm glass it's behind me. The wound in James' head (Photo: Police Handout) 
"I will feel nervous about going home and seeing friends and family. I don't know what kind of damage it's done. It was an ordeal I'm going to have to carry with my for the rest of my life." 
The star - who doesn't blame the woman, who has "expressed concern", but is no longer in touch with her - also opened up about the scar on the back of his head and possible concussion. The star is worried about the trauma of the incident (Photo: Rex Features) 
He added: "The worst thing about the physical damage is that I worry about head trauma — even when I’m playing football, something like heading the ball. I worry about it. Even moshing on stage." James Arthur and Gemma Iveson 
In a statement following the sentencing, Arthur said: “I would like to thank people for working on this case and I’m glad to put the episode behind me.” 
Arthur, who was taken to hospital and needed five staples in his head, had reportedly had a one-night stand with Gemma Iveson after she had broken up with Revell. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
